summary: Art Deco is a style of art and design that started in Paris before World War I. It was popular in the 1920s and 1930s, seen in buildings, fashion, and everyday items. The style is known for its bold, geometric shapes and bright colors, inspired by different cultures. Art Deco showed luxury and progress, using rare and new materials. Famous examples are the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building in New York. It changed to a smoother style during the Great Depression and ended with World War II.
title: Art Deco
